{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient had severe chest pain and died on the way to the hospital. At autopsy, tetrazolium chloride staining of the heart was done. Tetrazolium chloride is used to test for myocardial viability. If the myocardium is viable, it will stain blue; if it's not viable, it will stay white or gray. Since the patient died, we can assume the myocardium was non-viable. Therefore, the color of the ble myocardium would be... ", "answer_choice": B}
